Reviews.Title: “Rude Desk Clerk”
Reviews.Author: Jeff W
Reviews.Content: I am a carriage tour guide that passes by this hotel 5 times a day. Many of my clients ask about the Andrew Jackson Hotel and I tell them the little I know. I have never been inside the this hotel so I am limited on what I can tell my guests. On one of my few days off I was at the vet across the street waiting for appointment with my wife and the vet was running late. I thought I could take this time and check out the Andrew Jackson Hotel. I walked in and said hello. The desk clerk flashed me a nasty look and was even more rude with his verbal tone. I ignore all this and told him my reason for my visit. He refused to tell me his rates, refused to tell me anything about the hotel, I went to peek at the courtyard in the back and he yelled at me and told me to get out. If this was not weird enough, I called and e-mailed the manager to complain about the horrible experience. If I owned a buisness I would like to know if this type of thing goes on. I did not get any reponse. On my third call the manager he was in and I explained what I experienced and everything was going fine and the issue was almost over, then Mark started to tell me he could not figure out who was working the front desk yesterday at 3:30 PM and even if he could "there is always two sides to every story". When he started this speal I lost my temper. Who has ever heard in this day in age when a manager of a big hotel in a major tourist town has no Conflict Resolution Skills? (Manager. If you did not care, which i think is crazy.) Lets just say that not caring is actually acceptable. All you need to say is "thank you for your concern. I will look into this and I assure you I will deal with it." Then ask me about something personel; such as "Do you enjoy being a tour guide?, How did you fare with the hurricane?, Ready for summer to be done?" Then the call is done and I am happy. Why would you bring up there is two sided to any story even if your thinking it. You just called me a liar. Why would I call you if it was not true. Read some of these reviews and there is tone of people calling the desk clerk rude. Should we post a reponse that they are all liars. No wonder why there is always a vacancy sign up even during Mardi Gras season. I take over 10 thousand tourist by this place every year. I told more than 9 buggy drivers about my expeirence. That is over 100,000 tourist that will not be told anything about the Andrew Jackson Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great room at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Pam C
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at the Andrew Jackson hotel all the time when I was younger however it seemed like every time I wanted to stay there in recent years it was always booked up. Finally got a chance to take my husband there this past weekend. We paid a little extra for a room with a balcony and it was well worth it! The price we paid was about the price we would pay for a simple room with no balcony anywhere else in the French Quarter. Yes, the hotel is older... and hence there are things that need to be repaired. I'm sure they have a running list at all times. We loved the history behind the place ourselves. The room was clean and the hotel is SO close to anything and everything. It had a small 19" TV but we weren't there to watch TV. The bathroom looked like it had been updated recently. The staff.. Well, they are a little rough around the edges. The guy that worked pretty much the whole time we were there was pretty good once we buttered him up a bit but the guy that took his place on Monday did not have a bit of personality. We didn't want or need much so it didn't really matter to us at all. Hurricane Isaac was coming in the day we were leaving and friends of mine were forced to leave and I'm sure he could have made it more pleasant for them. I would reccomend this place to anyone that really wants to "experience" New Orleans. If you are a chain hotel type of person then don't go here, actually for that matter, you may not want to go to New Orleans. But if you want to experience the magic at a very reasonable price then this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Shelley N
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Andrew Jackson Hotel! What a nice clean place. Was a bit surprised by how small our room was but considering we did not spent 24/7 in the room it was fine. Staff were friendly enough and gave several great recommendations on sites to see and food to try! Would definitely suggest this place to others. Nice location and walking distance to all attractions and right next to Bourbon street!

Reviews.Title: “Save Your Money”
Reviews.Author: mama030
Reviews.Content: Really people, save up a little longer and get yourself a decent hotel room. No self control AC, a 2 inch gap at your front door, ie, the door's not long enough....hello, bugs get in and so does the very hot air. Did have effective ceiling fan. The ONLY plus is the hotel's location on the fabulous Royal St. Thank Goodness.

Reviews.Title: “A piece of history at the Andrew Jackson”
Reviews.Author: HinemoaHoney
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel! We arrived at the beginning of the heatwave and were so pleased to have a room with really good air conditioning. The room (and bathroom) was clean. The beds were comfortable. This is lovely historic building has been lovingly decorated 'New Orleans' style. The colour of the building and paintwork is what first attracted me to it. Being a couple of streets away from the main French Quarter, it is close (and safe) enough to walk, but far enough away that you don't hear the late night music and activities. The only drawback for us is that we were travelling around the States with two big heavy suitcases. Our room was located outside, up the external staircase. My partner, who is 63, had to carry both suitcases up the stairs, then down again at the end of our stay. It would have been a nice touch if the man at reception had offered to help. We didn't realise that breakfast was included until the last day - just as we were leaving! We weren't told. The service was mixed - there were three men on reception at different times during our stay, who provided various levels of service. One fellow was particularly friendly and helpful, and I'd like to see the other two follow his lead.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Kelly K
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Andrew Jackson Hotel, the room was very clean and the staff was great. We loved the atmosphere there, I enjoyed grabbing a cup of coffee and a bagel and just sitting in the courtyard before we started our day sightseeing. Staff was very helpful with answering questions and with making reservations and calling cabs and such. Would stay there again. Right in the French Quarter so it was close to everything we wanted to do.

Reviews.Title: “Not a happy camper!”
Reviews.Author: Tim39056
Reviews.Content: My room (and the hotel in general) was NOT AT ALL like the pictures on the A.J.'s web site. This place was a "Dump", I will NEVER, EVER, EVER, stay there again. Worth $25 - $45 per night MAX! Room was: Cramped. Dirty. Had no AC controls. Had a layer of grease / slim on most everything. Furniture was ripped, soiled, wood was peeling off dresser. Small 13 inch tv without dvd / game inputs. Bathroom: Paint chipping. Mold. Bad water pressure. MEGA Cramped, no room to dress. Loud plumbing noises throughout stay. STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Quaint”
Reviews.Author: PGott
Reviews.Content: This old (supposedly haunted) hotel/inn is conveniently located in the French Quarter, one block from the famous (infamous) Bourbon Street and two blocks from Jackson Square. The rooms are small albeit clean and well worth the cost. I loved the courtyard atmosphere, and the employees were very helpful and courteous. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location need attention”
Reviews.Author: NY425
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the best street right in the center of the french quarter so it is great for exploring the aeria.We had probably the best room overlooking Royal street with a big balcony. Unfortunatly, it seems that the owner doen't seems to be willing to do basic maintenance like providing handles on dressers(hard to open drawers without it)towel bar in the bathroom falling if you hang a towel on it.Its only small details and would cost almost nothing to fix if someone cared.rates were average for the aeria but you can get better deals in the aeria(better hotel)for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: guruarous
Reviews.Content: After all kinds of airport delays, we finally arrived a day behind the schedule to Andrew Jackson Hotel for my sons 18th birthday last summer. I have to say the hotel was not just welcoming, to make my sons birthday even better, they upgrade us to suite with the great view of Royal street. Finally my so miserable teenager was happy. the desk people help me to surprise my son with the steam boat Jaz dinner cruise. I am going back this year(not with my son:) with my sister and I am going to stay at Andrew Jackson again! There are many hotels with brand new doors and furniture, but in french quarter with this beautiful historic building how would brand new furniture look? people need to make their minds up. I love the history and ghostly shadows of lives that pass by here

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and very average”
Reviews.Author: RandBTravel
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an inexpensive hotel off from Bourbon that is simply a place to sleep, then this would work. The rooms are small and in definate need of updating. No A/C in our room. The staff did their jobs but didn't seem to be overly into it. Nice little courtyard and a very basic continental breakfast. The property is on Royal Street and is close enough to many of the French Quarter sites.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: Kim D
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews here and was a little concerned about what we'd find when we got to our rooms. As our friend says below, we were definitely pleasantly surprised. We had an upstairs, courtyard room. Our room was definitely spacious enough for our needs (sleeping & getting ready to wander about the French Quarter) and they were very clean. I wasn't expecting The Ritz for the price we paid and I was prepared for the lack of parking because of the reviews posted, so no surprises there. The hotel is old - built in 1888. If you want new or want something fancy, go somewhere else and pay more. Of course, you won't have authenticity or be as close to all the fun. The only complaints I have about my room are: 1) the bathroom was small and it was difficult to shower without hitting your elbows on the walls repeatedly and 2) you could hear every noise in the courtyard. Late Friday night/Saturday morning (Feb 24/25), while we were trying to sleep, some loud, drunk people were talking to someone on the cell phone with the SPEAKER TURNED ON. If you are reading this review, please tell the person on the other end of the phone that we miss her too, as you apparently wanted everyone in the hotel to hear the entire conversation. The courtyard itself was adorable. My husband and I grabbed a coffee at Community Coffee on the corner, came back and just sat there together for a bit before starting the day. The staff at the hotel was friendly, helping us get a parking space at the sister hotel, suggesting places for breakfast, and always ready to help answer any questions we had. Our friend posted below about our "encounters" with whatever it was. She did forget to mention the tapping I felt on the mattress next to my head. I asked my husband what he was doing. He said he wasn't doing anything and when he moved his hands, I realized they were on my leg. I look forward to our next visit and hope to get the chance to stay here again. It's a good price and a great location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wasted Opportunity”
Reviews.Author: DCPB4
Reviews.Content: We picked this place with another couple to celebrate a birthday and an anniversary based on the quaint description on the website. We should have read some of the reviews here first. We too experienced very poor customer service from the guy checking us in. We asked about the advertised free parking. He said it was a few blocks away but it was already full, so just park in a pay lot he showed us on a map. It was over a half mile away in a questionable area and cost $60/day! The room had worn-out beds and a bathroom door that would not close all the way. The carpet was very worn and the limited furnishings were dated. We had already decided to go elsewhere for breakfast but noticed that the breakfast consisted of a bag of frozen bagels and a pot of coffee. This place was a huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Haunted, perhaps . . . Charming yes.”
Reviews.Author: luvmysteries
Reviews.Content: This hotel is charming . . . some of the clerks, not so much. Our room was super small and you have to be a giant to reach the thermostat. But it is a good location and the one clerk working 1-30-12 was super helpful and kind. As for our haunted experience ... you be the judge: We stayed in room 206. Before we fall asleep my sister starts saying provocative things like "the ghost here suck" and we went to bed. About 1:30 in the morning the smoke alarm starts chirping at us . . . like it would if the battery was dying. My sister called the desk down stairs and we simply moved for the night to another room. In the morning I got up and headed back to the room to shower. As I was walking into the room, the alarm was still chirping. It chirped as I took my shower and while I got ready. The noise finally got on my nerves and I turned to the alarm and said "Okay, you can stop now" and low and behold it stop right then and there. When my sister came in she noticed that the noise was gone. She asked if they changed the battery. I told her "no" but that I told the ghost to stop. She looked at me and asked if I were telling the truth and I said "do you hear the chirping?" That was enough to convince her that maybe it was the ghosts playing their game.

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: Calder_Girl
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a charming courtyard and that is where it ended for me. We arrived late and were given a tiny cramped room with two beds and no window save the one in the bathroom, which had a disgusting bathtub that leaked. It was noisy and smelly but it was too late to go anywhere else. The breakfast consisted of doughnuts and not-very-good coffee...ugh. We checked out early and found a wonderful place two streets away (the Provincial Hotel) for a better value and far ahead of this place in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: Dena M
Reviews.Content: We made our reservation for New Years in May of last year. When we arrived on Dec 30th, we were told our room had a problem and they moved us to St. Pierre - their sister property. This hotel is a dump and the manager has NO people skills. Our room had stained bedspreads and one small window at the top of the room. The next day, they offered to move us back to the AJ but by then we had already unpacked. However, we did visit the room that we reserved at the AJ....much nicer.....instead, we asked the manager to allow us to check out one night early for all the inconvenience they had caused us and the fact that we didn't get the hotel or room we reserved. He flat out refused and wouldn't provide any renumeration for a less than sub-par room. His remark was at least they provided a roof over our heads....the location was much further away from where we wanted to be. And, the reservation that we printed off DID NOT contain the fact that they had a 3 night minimum on it. They need to clean house here and get some decent folks that know how to treat customers. I will never stay at either one of these hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: HermitageTraveler
Reviews.Content: I cancelled my reservation 60 days prior to staying at this hotel and was told I still had to pay for it. They absolutely refused to allow me to change dates. After numerous attemps to speak to a manager, I contatcted the Better Business Bureau. Their manager replied to them and stated that I never called and that it clearly states on their website that there are no refunds prior to 30 days before any stay. I still have my phone records, but live out of state. I'm trying to help anyone not to fall into the same problem as I did. I spent $1000. on my debit card for a trip I never took. It decimated my bank account and will take a long time to rebound. Zero customer service, and rude desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Price Trumps Shabbiness”
Reviews.Author: eurotraveler
Reviews.Content: The Andrew Jackson Hotel is located on Royal Street, far enough from the Bourbon Street madness but close enough to all the rest of the fun things to do in the French Quarter. We had a room just off the reception area - the window in the room is right on the sidewalk, so when tour groups stop out in front you get 5-10 minutes of unwanted narrative. For being so close to the street, there was surpringly little noise from the street. Breakfast is provided but there are no tables and seats in the reception area - Community Coffee is only a few doors down on the left. We had a large room that was kept clean but could use a renovation and updating. The bathroom was not dirty, but it looked as if the caulking and tiling was done by an amateur. Not dirty, just really shabby workmanship. You could do better no doubt but not at this price and in this location.

Reviews.Title: “Haunted!”
Reviews.Author: Jaime S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old and quaint. Rooms are extremely basic. The location is excellent for French Quarter activities and has an chic courtyard restaurant, Cafe Amelie, across the street. I did not believe in hauntings until I stayed here! They have a history of "friendly" hauntings, but I did not expect to experience anything. However, two nights in a row, we returned to our room to find my clothing moved. The first night, clothes thrown about with some folded in front of the door when we opened it. The second night my pajamas laid out like a person on the bed with a small hobbit door high above the bathroom that was open (it was definitely closed before and we could not reach it). Creepy to say the least...We thought the hotel staff may have been involved to perpetuate the haunted rumor, but they denied it. Also, cleaning staff comes early and leaves early. In the evenings there is only one hotel attendant who mans the desk so it seems unlikely that he would leave his post to mess with my clothes!

Reviews.Title: “Harry Potter's Closet Under the Stairs Was Bigger”
Reviews.Author: SavyGran
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room with twin beds through a travel deal website. I selected it based on photos and reviews on the site and the Andrew Jackson website. I confirmed the room shortly after buying the deal and again a few days before my departure. They were very friendly and courteous. The exterior was charming and the hotel's location was perfect: close to attractions and public transportation, and just far enough from Bourbon Street to limit the noise. Their sister hotel, about 3 blocks away, had 2 small pools, which we were permitted to use. Our room was another matter and a huge disappointment. The door opened off the marble floored hallway that led from the lobby to the courtyard rooms. This door was the only ventilation for our room, as the bathroom window was painted shut and there was no bathroom fan. The lone AC vent did not offer any relief and a couple of nights we slept with the door ajar, on its little safety chain, because the hallway was dramatically cooler. This lack of AC and ventilation is why there was so much mold on the tub's surround. The bedspreads were cute, but the rest of the room was dismal. No real decor (undersized and mismatched garage sale pictures) and there was some sort of storage area or utility access bulkhead with doors that jutted out about 3' and stretched across much of the room. A tall dresser (not an antique and not charming) prevented the bathroom door from opening all the way and the closet was small and oddly shaped. The bachelor party occupying the remaining rooms off the interior hallway woke us up repeatedly for two nights in a row. Suitcases rolling down the hall between the lobby and the courtyard rooms beat a loud and reverberating cadence, followed by the slamming of the exterior door that was adjacent to our door. The reverse order was repeated for early morning departures. The chandelier above the doors shone brightly through the glass top of our door (which did not open for ventilation), despite a cheap mini-blind installed obviously to block it. The continental breakfast was a thermos of coffee and a box of donuts in the lobby. One morning there was a selection of small cereal boxes on the sideboard. I poked my head into a courtyard room one morning, while the maid was cleaning. Much nicer, with 2 big beds and cuter decor. Don't know if the AC was any better. When I complained to the desk clerk, I was advised I could pay $50 more a night and we would be moved to another room. My advice is to ask for photos of the room you will be getting before making your reservation here.

Reviews.Title: “B-Day Week-end in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: txsphinx
Reviews.Content: Went to New Orleans for a B-Day Weekend and stayed at the Andrew Jackson. Great location and everyone was so helpful and nice. Everything was in walking distance to places we wanted to go. Room and Bath Room was clean and staff kept it that way. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: bchprof
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a business convention and wanted to be in the French Quarter. This place was perfect. The rooms are a bit older than new chain hotels - but that's the idea of getting a place in the French Quarter. Nice courtyard. We bought a couple bottles of wine at nearby stores and met people from around the world in the courtyard each evening. A couple blocks to French Market, great restaurants, and one block off the end of Bourbon Street but quiet at night. Friendly and helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Andrew Jackson Hotel for a lovely N.O. visit!”
Reviews.Author: kstaunton
Reviews.Content: My husband had our annual trip to N.O. May 27-31 and we stayed at the Andrew Jackson Hotel. The location is awesome, the staff is friendly, and the room was very clean and quaint. We had our breakfast in the quiet courtyard. The Hotel offers coffee and pastries in the morning. I would recommend staying here, but be prepared for all the "ghost tour" stops in front!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: DeAnna2002
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the historic Andrew Jackson Hotel when I make my yearly visits to the city. The knowledgable and friendly staff of the hotel make each stay a pleasure. The rooms are comfortable, and the courtyard is beautiful. A great location combined with a great staff makes this hotel a bargain for anyone wanting to stay in the heart of the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Identity theft at risk”
Reviews.Author: 4thelife
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a company policy to photo copy your credit card and drivers license. This information is kept for years! Who could have access, alot of people!!! When requesting that at the very least the numbers of the credit card be blacked out was refused, I had no choice but to protect myself by cancelling my card.....BEWARE!!!! THIS IS JUST SUCH A MAJOR THREAD AWAY FROM IDENTITY THEFT!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JDH45
Reviews.Content: After reading several of the reviews on this website, my wife and I were hesitant to book a room here but we are very glad we did. First off let me start out by saying that this property is a few hundred years old and on the National Resitry of Historic Places. If you do not know what that is or what it entails, don't stay here. If you're looking for big, spacious, modern rooms with lot's of amenities, don't stay here. But if you want the charm and ambiance of New Orleans and the French Quarter, by all means this is the place for you. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. Very informative and very proud of their property and the history it represents. Yes, the rooms are small and the bathrooms are smaller, but they are adeqaute, clean, and serve their purpose. We came to the French Quarter to celebrate our anniversary, so we didn't plan on spending alot of time in a room anyway, however when we were there, everything was fine. We had a problem with the bed the first night we were there, and after reporting it in the morning to the front desk it was quickly resolved by replacing it with a new bed. We have traveled extensively and stayed at many 5 star resorts and hotels, and had slower service with mixed results. Not here, the staff bent over backwards to make sure our stay was satisfactory. If anything could be improved, it would be the breakfast. Coffee and dougnuts and some cold cereal, but then again, you're in New Orleans and the Cafe Du'Mond is only a short two block walk away and a diner just around the corner serves 24 hour breakfast at very reasonable rates (around $6 for a full breakfast). All told, it was a great stay. The location is the best, we parked our car when we arrived and never went back to it until we left. Everything was in walking distance. When we return to New Orleans, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “happy camper!”
Reviews.Author: tevagrrrl
Reviews.Content: my friend & i met up in new orleans for a long weekend in the french quarter. we are a couple of old girls that enjoy good food as well as casual, relaxing evenings. we wanted to stay somewhere convenient to good restaurants, that was pleasant & had french quarter character. we got just what we needed at the andrew jackson hotel! our room was comfy & clean. right outside our room was a sweet & cozy courtyard with the occasional neighborhood cat passing through...perfect for chilling out with a glass of wine while resting our feet. last, but not at all least...the staff! they were awesome! they made us feel like we were staying with family!

Reviews.Title: “A good joint.”
Reviews.Author: Ironchefmeister
Reviews.Content: Its in a great location just down the road from the crazy part of the French Quarter so its quiet but still within walking distance to everything. The rooms are small and old but thats not really a bad thing, especially in New Orleans. The courtyard and fountain is a great place to relax and gives a real good authentic feel. Don't expect a five star resort, but if you want a clean, quiet place to sleep but still be near everything this is a good joint.

Reviews.Title: “NO, NO, NO!! Reminded me of the movie "The Shining" eerry”
Reviews.Author: Somegirlnhtown
Reviews.Content: Please, I beg of anyone not to stay in this disgusting hotel. First off, me and two friends went to this hotel for Bayou Classics as we frequent New Orleans every year. They were misleading on there advertisement and eventhough you book a "standard double room" they will try and gimmick you and give you a "full size bed" and claim it is what you reserved. It is also the 3rd listed haunted hotel so I didn't like that either as we researched it later on that night. We had 3 woman to a room and when we got to the room it looked like a torture chamber. This hotels days should be numbered and they have limited parking so eventhough it is advertised with free parking, I guarantee you will not get free parking and when you find a parking spot you will have to walk 7 blocks to get back to the room. I have nothing positive to say about this hotel. We did not even stay in the hotel. We ended up paying extra towards a suite at there sister property. Also, in the long run when I got home and called bookit.com, they informed me that we did in fact book double beds so I am currently waiting for my refund from them. Bookit.com was wonderful, but this hotel ran me so hot that I will make it my duty to come out with a blog about this disgraceful and unaccomadating hotel! I am telling you, don't waste your money. Oh and the location sucks too! Would I recommend it to a friend HE^^ NO and not to my worst enemy!

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible but won't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: smithtk
Reviews.Content: The hotel doesn't quite match the description on the website. Continental breakfast = coffee, donuts and maybe some cereal. Spacious guest rooms = I had to close the door to the bathroom to see myself in the mirror. Our room needed paint, and so did the fixtures in the bathroom which had chips, but the room was as clean as it could get - it just looked shabby. There was not a hairdryer or ironing board in the room. I could hear the housekeepers talking in the next room through the wall and you could easily hear the people talking in the courtyard. The staff were not rude as noted in other reviews but not going out of their way to make a good impression as we have experienced at other hotels in the quarter. The location is great, the bed was comfortable, the price was good, and we are never in our room in New Orleans anyway so it wasn't a big deal, but we won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but NOT GREAT”
Reviews.Author: mmraggett
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with a group of friends and my girlfriend in October of 2010. Overall, I would say its below average/decent. The rooms are not very large, the showers have little to NO water pressure, there is no sort of food you can get except for the semi continental breakfast/coffee in the mornings, and the staff is not very friendly at all. The over night desk person is the absolute worst, basically just picture a person who absolutely hates their job and life, with the little bit of power that they have is working/controling the front desk of a hotel late at night. This man couldn't have been ruder to our group when we were trying to get our rooms back from him to go into our rooms. A lot of third degree and questioning of who we were and our intentions even though we were cleary in his system as registered to those individual rooms. If you can find a different hotel in the French Quarter, like the Hotel St. Louis, I would definitley recommend staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Service, & Location”
Reviews.Author: AnthVick
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! We stayed in room 110, it was the 'middle of the spectrum' as far as their different rates went. The room was nearly perfect! It was in a 'separate' building (perhaps the old carriage house?) across the small courtyard. We loved being so close to the 'action', but it was peaceful at the hotel. Just one block from the Community Coffee Shop which was excellent. WIFI was questionable. Sometimes I could connect, sometimes I couldn't. We'd definitely stay here (in the same room) again!

Reviews.Title: “Will be staying there again!”
Reviews.Author: nicholasmg
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from vacation in New Orleans and we loved our stay at the Andrew Jackson Hotel. After reading some of the previous reviews, I was scared about what to expect when I got there, but was very pleased with our experience. The hotel is blocks away from everything we wanted to do- the French Market, Bourbon Street, the Aquarium. If you are a person who likes to spend a lot of time in a hotel room, this may not be the place for you. Our room was small, but clean and beautiful. As some other reviewers stated, the TV is small, but I did not go on vacation to watch TV. The staff was very, very nice and helpful. Overall, we had a great experience and we will be staying there again when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “A roach motel would be an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: omar8816
Reviews.Content: The staff is rude and the hotl is run down the bathrooms are nasty not worth what I. Paid. Stay away from this roach motel

Reviews.Title: “Very charming, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: tracschn
Reviews.Content: The Andrew Jackson is conveniently located near most attractions, yet quiet. The rooms are fairly small but clean. The furnishings could be updated or refinished. The courtyard was a nice place to eat the complimentary donuts and coffee in the morning. The staff was very friendly and helpful. If you are looking for large extravigant rooms, stay at one of the chains BUT if you are looking for rooms with a history and a fun laid back atmosphere, close to all the attractions then stay at the Andrew Jackson. We would most definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “In need of TLC!”
Reviews.Author: NOLAGirls3
Reviews.Content: I live in New Orleans and thought it would be a treat to stay at a boutique hotel for a "sister's weekend". The location of this hotel is perfect. That's about all the good I can say. I booked the trip for the 3 of us and was very disappointed and even embarrassed as soon as we opened the door to our room. The door did not quite fit the jam properly, not unusual for a settling 100+ yr old house, except this door was barely secured. The room as very dingy with old stained carpet and a chip on the headboard of a bed. It literally looked like a huge chunk had been ripped off. STRANGE. The same bed (we had 2 queens) was lopsided; I suppose the frame was broken. No internet, no cable TV also very strange, no iron, or hairdryer.....no attempt do something "extra". The bathroom - the very small bathroom with a pedestal sink and barely enough room to get dressed was in dire need of repair. The painted over tile was beginning to peel and the tub could have used lots of bleach. The courtyard had not yet been spruced up for spring so the tropical plants (which was all of the plants) were dead from the winter and the fountain was not running but an algae mess. Shame on the owners and managers. Good thing our weekend was spent dining and sipping libations in more luxurious surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “They will gladly take your money and not give you much in return”
Reviews.Author: wireman774
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms for 3 nights over the net. When we arrived in town and got our rooms what a disappointment. They charged for a queen size bed but provided a full size bed. I tried to work my disagreement out with the front desk and the General Manager Stu with no success. Stu and the front desk staff were very rude and could not careless about the problem. Stu said the beds were of queen size therefore he would not make any changes. I personally have a queen size bed that I sleep in every night so I think I know the difference between a queen and full size beds. I paid $200.00 more for a queen size bed but only received the full and to make things worse other friends in our party had the very same rooms and paid for full size beds. Stu even said to me "It sounds like sour grapes because your friends paid less." No Stu, it's not sour grapes, its all about being fair! The rooms also do not have air conditioning like the web site says and the windows are nailed shut. Reserve a room here at your own risk!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanielH34
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, comfortable beds, and close to where the action is!

Reviews.Title: “These people are crooks...DON'T STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: amarie73
Reviews.Content: I booked a trip in the middle of November for New Years Eve on their website, and 2 weeks later I had to cancel due to a family death. I called the hotel and spoke with the woman at the front desk and she told me they would still charge me the deposit or one nights stay ($179.00) but that I could speak with the manager. She gave me the managers number and he NEVER returned my call! I called 15-20 times within 2 weeks and still no call back. I did call and cancel with the front desk for the remainder of the money ($406.00). I thought everything was resolved and went on with my life....only out $179.00. WELL, I checked my bank statement a month later and they had charged me for the ENTIRE STAY!!! They charged for the $179.00 deposit and once for $402.00 for the rest of the days!!!! I called the hotel and asked to speak with one of the managers, Gary or Stu, and of course they were not available. Stu finally returned my call the next day and I explained what had happened hoping once again to get this resolved. Stu told me there was nothing he would do to fix it and was EXTREMELY RUDE!!! He said he would not refund my money. I canceled 3 WEEKS IN ADVANCE!!! I would not even recommend this hotel to my worst enemy! THEY WILL STEAL ANY MONEY THEY CAN GET!!! THIEVES! UNLESS YOU WANT YOUR MONEY STOLEN...DO NOT STAY WITH THE ANDREW JACKSON HOTEL OR THE PIERRE HOTEL!!! SAME PEOPLE RUN BOTH!!!!! A BUNCH OF CROOKS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here, run by crooks”
Reviews.Author: HermitageTraveler
Reviews.Content: I got a reservation to stay hear for a few days in late December. 2 months before this I cancelled my reservations. When I called in the evening around 6:00 pm I was told, " too bad, you still have to pay for it." Then I was hung up on. After calling the manager and leaving messages 20 days in a row without a callback I tried again with the hotel lobby. Once again a very rude person told me I would be charged for all of the days. He then charged my credit card that day. So please stay away from this place they are not you're friends and will not help you if you need any help. I called on my weekend to see if they had any rooms and was told they were completely booked and had no vacancies. Being a frequent traveler I will never forget how hateful these people are, and how they treated me. If you work hard for you're money STAY AWAY

Reviews.Title: “Awfullllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllll”
Reviews.Author: REDD48
Reviews.Content: I have been to HOTELS before but this was the worst, I have stayed in historical places in the quarters before (Quarter House) very historical place( beautiful). The pic on the website is VERY misleading. I paid 800+ for 2 roms 2 nights. I couldn't stay the second night and couldn't cancelled nor get a refund. The only hotel that was available at the time was the Windsor Court Hotel very expensive but a beautiful place, even though I was looking for a historical place i just couldn't have my famiily stay in that place. That's letting you know how disappointed I(we) all were. Stay at your own risk not appealing/comfortable at all

Reviews.Title: “What did you expect”
Reviews.Author: aldean323
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel in the french quarter. It has personality that a new hotel does not. Does it have some minor maint issues, yes they all do. The rooms are small but, all rooms are small in the french quarter. If you want a large chain hotel experience they are available as are 5 star hotels. This hotel is exactly what it claims to be. Very few hotels in this area offer on site parking. Read about the hotel before you book and you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Derick the worst clerk on the planet.”
Reviews.Author: Tdcypress1965
Reviews.Content: I called the front desk because of a problem with our room. That is not even important anymore, because things go wrong with old building. The larger problem was with Derick ( enjoy the spelling ) the night shift front desk clerk. He informed me that the cable being out was not his problem, and I should be sleeping anyway. He then hung up the phone on me. Yes, I did run down stairs to question him on his lack of service to hotel guest, and asked for his name so I could log a complaint. He refuesed to give me his name. I finally got his name after an hour of discussion which included him suggestion to me that the best thing I could do would be to shut up and return to my room. He also informed me that he could have me removed from the property, to witch I replied, because I have a problem with my room and you are rude to guess. I don't usually write reviews or complain, but I was shocked at the how rude this person was. If you decided to stay at this very old hotel and anything is not what you expected, don't expect any understanding or help from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in premier location”
Reviews.Author: louisianagy
Reviews.Content: Here is what you get in an old French Quarter hotel: small rooms, walls with peeling paint, imperfect bathroom fixtures, etc... I have stayed at many different hotels throughout the Quarter and alot have the same features that people complain about... "the rooms are small, the carpet wasn't nice and pristine." If you want to stay in a 5 star hotel, this isn't that place for you... other than that this place is fabulous. The location is great, along with a fabulous courtyard. I had no issue with hot water in the shower. This place could use a renovation, but after all, the building is well over 100 years old... You should stay here if you are looking for a nice, quiet place to rest your head while on a get away to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Location Great but Hotel Not”
Reviews.Author: reshy29
Reviews.Content: Before even getting their we had issues with the hotel because come to find out the rooms we booked were much smaller and had hardly any room. We had to fight with the front desk to get that changed then there is not water pressure in the hotel because it is so old. If you like to really old buildings for a place to stay you will like this place if not then it is not for you. The location is great but the hotel not so much. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: hellotmf
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere - very New Orleans style. The people that work there are very nice and helpful and the location can't be beaten. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “History Buffs will love this place”
Reviews.Author: dbaughart
Reviews.Content: The Andrew Jackson is rich in history. This is an old hotel that is a little rough around the edges, but most "historical" hotels in the French Quarter have some issues with upkeep. If you are expecting the Ritz, go somewhere else. If you like great locations, unbeatable price, and friendly service, give it a try. The rooms are small but clean. Bathrooms show wear and tear, but were functional. The bed was comfortable and the pillows were fluffy, contrary to some reviews here. The walls are thin, but the area is in the "lower quarter" which is very quiet. Great location for walking, 2 blocks from River, 1 block to Bourbon street. The patio is small, but quaint. Like I said, most older hotels in New Orleans have some issues with upkeep, but this is worth the bargain. One last note, the staff was the friendliest collection of hotel staff I have ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: Apple_traveller
Reviews.Content: It was a couple of years back now but i thought i would write up a review on my experience at the Andrew Jackson... We turned up (in the off season) on the doorstep just looking for some cheap accomodation somewhere convenient in the french quarter. There were 5 of us travelling around the US on the cheap and this meant sharing a room everywhere we went... Anyway, we were greeted by a Clay Aiken lookalike on the door (similar accent and everything) and due to the fact that we couldnt really sneak half of us into the room without going past this guy, explained our situation to him. He was not only cool with it but for the price of the room with only a double upgraded us into a larger, comfy room just off the courtyard. Loved the location, was a sweet room, great service and good times all round... I dont know how up to date this is and maybe Clay isnt working there anymore but i would still give the AJ the thunmbs up if you are looking for somewhere to stumble back to after a big night on Bourbon street...

Reviews.Title: “All I could do is laugh.”
Reviews.Author: TheMissGal
Reviews.Content: The best thing I can say regarding this hotel is it's great location. If you want to be steps away from everything and are not picky, it's ok. Not good, not great, just ok. "Worn" is a good term to use to describe the facility. Our room was extremely small with furniture which looked like it had been bought from a roadside flea market. As everyone stated previously, the bed felt as though we were sleeping on an oak door. The hand sewn curtains and plastic mini blinds did not meet the wall, which enabled ample amounts of streetlight to bounce freely about the room. There are no thermostats, so if you get cold easily or burn up, tough. Yes, it was stated our room came complete with a bathroom. What it did not say was that it only contained a very small "soap the walls and spin" shower-stall with a curtain that was a foot shy of the floor. Oh yeah, very limited parking is an understatement. Enjoy their "free" fitness program when you are forced to walk 5 blocks in order to park your car at the Mississippi River (Parking is NOT free, Go on an add an additional $20.00 a day). Since I only live 2 hours away, we spend ample time in the Quarter every year. We have stayed several places better and worse than this hotel. The bottom line is we only paid $89.10 a night to sleep in The French Quarter(plus $80.00 parking). Notice I said "sleep". The room was clean, the location was great, but if you are looking for a posh resort with all the amineties, this ain't it. If you are a "go with the flow type", which could sleep anywhere just to have a good time, book away. :)

Reviews.Title: “What an experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: cmeyers
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel stay in a rush.. not reading reviews, which is important. I read the reviews after we booked(before we got there) Let me inform you of what its really like. It is in a nice area. It is one block from bourban, two blocks from decauter. The secure parking lot is three blocks away by the St. Pierre hotel. The hotel is supposely haunted. It feels that way when you walk in. I want not advise you to stay with children at this hotel. The rooms are incrediable small. The rooms are old looking. THE BED, at least the room we stayed in, ARE SO HARD. Which one review said.... We brought our own pillow and blanket. It is almost like staying in someone else's bed. The hosts were very nice, but werid! The hotel is supposely haunted by two kids... its scary. Not a comforable place to stay. It kinda smells in the hotel..Not a strong nasty smell...but just like an old smell! We were sooooo werided out by the first 4 hours we were there...that we honestly were going to eat our money and go to another hotel room in New Orleans. Also..There is NO returns for any reason.... There is a two night minimum..... I believe if you cancel your first night before you stay you only pay the rate of one night! Not exactly what I would call a nice cosy stay! Please read reviews before you stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a little worn, terrible front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: texaspooky
Reviews.Content: This small hotel has a great location on Royal in the French Quarter. It is a little worn, not the best mattresses, but having stayed in other older properties in New Orleans, this one is not that bad. I am not sure it is worth the 149.00 per night weekend price. My complaint is the front desk clerk and his attitude. He was just plain rude to anyone who asked any questions with exaggerated physical gestures. He critisized the hotel guests "stupid questions" after they left his presence and did it loud enough that other guests could hear. I would not go back because of this person.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!”
Reviews.Author: kilmistr
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at the Andrew Jackson Hotel. I have never experienced any hotel stay like this one in my life. I have stayed at hotels during Christmas and New Years and have never encountered anything like this. (please check my other reviews). My wife & I really wanted to stay at this hotel, instead of a chain hotel. I called the hotel on Dec. 26th to confirm my reservation of a double bed room. The staff said my reservation was fine. I told the staff we would arrive at 10:00 p.m. on Dec. 29th. The moment we checked in there was a problem. The staff told us the heat was broken in our double bed room. (the hotel web site states that the rooms are heated, it was 40 degree weather). I was told they were working on fixing it. Fine, we took a single bed room, our friend was not arriving until the next day. The next morning my wife asked about our double bed room. My wife was shown a double bed room and the front desk clerk stated the maid needed to clean the room first, then it would be ready for us. We went to breakfast, then returned to the hotel an hour later. Upon arriving, the same desk clerk informed us that we could not have the room. When we asked why, we were told we had to call Travelocity, since we did not have a contract with the hotel. My wife asked if their sister hotel St. Pierre had any double bed rooms. The clerk said no. In all the years and places I have travelled, I have never heard of being shown a room, then told I could not have it. Usually, if there is a problem, guests are upgraded, not downgraded. There was no physical way 3 grown adults could even fit into the small single bed they gave us the night before. I called my credit card company with whom I reserved the room with. After they contacted the hotel, they told me to check the hotel St. Pierre. My wife & I walked 3 blocks to that hotel. They indeed had "2" double bed rooms available (we were just told by Andrew Jackson Hotel staff there were no rooms available). We stayed at hotel St. Pierre until 12/1/08. Please read my review of that hotel. To be fair to the Andrew Jackson hotel, I emailed the G.M. after we returned home, asking why we could not have a double bed room that we had reserved. He replied that he was "vaguely familiar with the situation" and that he would get back with me. I never heard from him again. My credit card company contacted the hotel & the G.M. stated he would resolve the situation with me personally. When I told the credit card company he had not gotten back with me, they contacted him again. The G.M. told the credit card company that the hotel server crashed and he had no information about what happened during my stay. He offered me a 2 free night stay at the hotel. I declined. Why would I go back to this hotel? First my room wasnt available, then it was available, then after it was shown to us, it wasn't available. Their sister hotel had no double rooms available, then it had 2, but the one room with heat (in 40 degree weather) was an extra charge of $20 a night? It has taken me over 1 month to get this situation resolved & I still have no explanation of what happened. I love New Orleans, and I will go back again, but I will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: peacocksuit
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3-night stay at the Andrew Jackson. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the rooms were comfortable. The location is excellent, a little away from the craziness of Bourbon but still well within walking distance of everything. Overall, this was a great stay. I will concur with other posters about the breakfast, it's a joke with only donuts and coffee, but I didn't care too much about that. I don't quite understand why the hair dryers have to be borrowed from the front desk, but that's not a big deal either. My biggest problems wer the lack of a thermostat in the room (I understand that it's an old building but it was either sweltering or freezing) and the first morning I was there, there was no hot water, even after I waited 30 minutes. Taking a freezing cold shower will wake you up though!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: skimom2
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Andrew Jackson. Great location! The room was very clean, comfortable beds and plenty of towels. The courtyard was beautiful with just enough privacy. I cannot commend the staff enough. They were all so friendly, from the gentleman who assisted me with my reservations to the front desk staff who never failed to greet us. A special thanks to AJ who was so willing to share his stories and help us get the most out of our visit. Wow! For a few days we felt like New Orleanians. Shawna, KY

Reviews.Title: “Hotel website inaccurate”
Reviews.Author: KW2000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a weekend in New Orleans staying one night at the Andrew Jackson. We usually stay in the Garden District because rates are more reasonable, free parking is provided, and the French Quarter is only a trolley ride away. However, the Papa Noel rate of $79 convinced us to stay in the Quarter for a change. Unfortunately, as their website states, parking is limited and we paid an additional $20 per day for parking, Keep this in mind when rates are quoted. My main gripe with this hotel is the inaccuracies on their website. No continental breakfast (only coffee with a jug of powdered creamer), no hair dryers in room, no irons and ironing boards in room. Additional negatives include flat bed pillows, scratchy sheets, no thermostat in room, and the room had only a double bed. On the positive side, the hotel is located in the middle of the French Quarter and the morning desk staff was very accomodating (can't say the same for the evening shift). Also, the bathroom in our standard room was very clean and modern. In closing, the accomodations were adequate, but don't count on the amenities described on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: mtnbyrne
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect stay for my friend and I. I am a frequent traveler to New Orleans, and this by far, was the best hotel I have ever stayed in. The courtyard was lovely, and had a chance to make friends with some of our fellow travelers. The staff were extremely helpful, and willing to point us in any direction for food and jazz. It's proximity to Bourbon Street and all the shopping of the French Market was perfect, but also allowed for some quiet time when the day was over. I would recommend this hotel to anyone heading to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Andy Jackson was great!”
Reviews.Author: londonwesty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Andrew Jackson from January 9th to the 14th, 2007. Myself, my wife and 2 kids, 15 and 13. We booked the Andrew Jackson because of its historical association to the real Andrew Jackson, its quaintness and its location. The hotel is nicely appointed but it is not a Hilton or a Red Roof Inn. This our daughter noticed right away. The rooms are part of an old house and things are not modern. The staff were very friendly and very glad we came to stay in New Orleans. The city is getting back to normal. The French Quarter and area is not affected at all for the most part. Other areas of the city are still recovering. We are so glad we made the journey and used our travel money to help bring life back to this needed area. The Hotel is only one block from Bourbon Street and 2 blocks from Andrew Jackson Square. There is an A&P within 3 blocks and a great coffee shop (CC's) on the corner next door. If you want to be in THE French Quarter consider staying at the Andrew Jackson Hotel. You will love its location, old style, location and friendly and wonderful staff. LondonWesty. London, Ontario.

Reviews.Title: “Enyoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here when doing the Jazzfest and found no problems with anything.Our room was on the first floor in front.They have very limited parking but there are public parking lots not far away.I found our room simple but clean and with a nice feeling,especially the spaciousness that a 14-foot ceiling provides. The staff in my opinion really made every effort to answer any tourist-type questions about the city,we had many. Location is super,lots of shops and reseraunts a short walk away.Whatever past problems they may have had have been dealt with.I would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Earthspirit
Reviews.Content: Went to New Orleans Feb 17-19th. Picked Andrew Jackson because of its name and location in the Quarter. I loved it. Yes it is small, but I was not there looking for a Holiday Inn. I love the small and quaint. Staff were more than helpful. Price was great. Location was fantastic. Could walk to Bourbon Street in only a minute or two (only one block over). I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is up for adventure and NOT just looking for a place to impress someone.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel has so many problems, I do not know where to begin: our room was not clean and the furnishings were sparse--the mattress was horrible. We did not have a remote for the small TV--no biggie, but when we requested one from the staff, it never arrived. The courtyard rooms were loud and if want to sleep in, forget about it....there was so much light coming through the gap in the front door, it was impossible. The staff was not helpful and really rather rude. There are many wonderful places to stay in New Orleans for the right price--this place is definitely not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great anniversary getaway!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our 14th wedding anniversary trip and the first time without any of the kids along. We stayed in the King Suite with a balcony on the second floor. It was fantastic! Eating breakfast out on the balcony as the sun rose and then in the evening having some drinks before going out. The room was very spacious and the bed quite comfortable. The furnishings were consistant with the age of the hotel. Our only issue was that the carpet seemed a bit sticky, so we just kept on some type of shoes. Not a real issue. The location is FANTASTIC! We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. The carriage tours passed in front of the hotel so we can now tell you the history of the hotel and the Cornstalk fence very well! Parking was as usual in the Quarter. We never did find a space in the hotel's lot or the sister hotel's lot but we were able to find parking (FREE) within 3-4 blocks and this was fine. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. At one point our toilet was not filling quickly. We called the front desk and within 10 minutes someone was there and it was fixed. I would recommend the Andrew Jackson to anyone - especially the second floor king suite with the balcony. It's a little more pricey but worth it. We have also stayed at its sister hotel - the Hotel St. Pierre- and would recommend it too. For being in the Quarter the prices can not be beaten. Our stay was 3 weeks before Hurricane Katrina hit. We pray the hotel can revive!

Reviews.Title: “I tried to fly home early, just to get out of that dump!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really regret booking at this hotel. The staff could care less, the room was small, furnished with junk and the door had huge gaps all the way around it. I could not sleep, I was scared at what might crawl in the gaps. And of course there is not any parking. We were told we could park at the sister hotel, but the lot was full. We had to park 8 blocks away. Terrible, Terrible do not waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it, @ any price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Room was small, dirty and smelled. Ladies of the evening worked the hotel and every night would bring "customers". Outside the lobby they would solicit. My boyfriend & I were asked a number of times if we were in New Orleans & wanted to have some fun. The room was dirty and smelled terrible. "Guests" were very loud. Don't waste your time and especially your money!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet room but Horrible in every other way”
Reviews.Author: Muffin06
Reviews.Content: I submitted this following complaint to the Better Business Bureau of New Orleans: I stayed at the Andrew Jackson Hotel at 919 Royal Street for 3 nights, checking in on July 21, 2005, and out on July 24, 2005. I was told I would receive an email confirmation of my reservations, but I never received any email from the hotel. Upon checking in, I had to present my credit card. I used my BankOne debit card which also serves as a Visa credit card. I was charged for the full room price plus $30 for using a debit card. I was unaware of this $30 charge, because it was not explained or even mentioned to me. I signed the paper agreeing to pay the full amount. When I checked my bank balance the next day, this amount had been taken out. I then realized I was not given a receipt for signing, only my two room keys. Upon attempting to check out, the woman ran my debit card again without asking me for my card, because she already had the card numbers in her system. I was this time charged for the full room price, minus the $30 debit card fee. At no point during check in or check out or my visit was I informed they would run my card twice for whatever reason. When she presented me with the card receipt to sign, I asked her if I hadn't already signed one when I checked in. She said yes but this was the real charge. She then informed me the first money debited from my account was being "held" or "frozen" then told me I could call my bank with my receipt information to have them release the first charge from the hotel so I could have the money back in my account. I asked her to clarify why they were double charging me, and she said they were not. However, I had already signed two debit card receipts at this point and had her tell me I would have to call my bank. I didn't understand how this could not be double charging, so I asked for her to explain again. She attempted twice, and the first explanation sounded as if the money from my account was just being held and when this authorization went through, it would be released to them. Upon further questioning, the woman said it was being held by the bank but this charge would be taken also and I would have to still get my first amount of money back somehow. It was during this I was told that I had incurred a $30 charge for using a debit card the first time. The second receipt did not include this charge, and I was not told if it was still going to be taken from the account or anything. I finally just took my receipt and left in utter confusion. I still do not understand any of their logic as it seems to change every moment. The room was expensive enough with all of its problems then to have to deal with this issue was ridiculous. Please see below for a list of room problems. I was also charged $1.50 for long distance telephone charges when checking out. The phone number was a toll free 800 number. The hotel also employs false advertising. On their website, the hotel is shown in the pictures as white. The hotel is actually yellow. There were no hair dryers in the room, I do not know if you had to ask for one or not. There is also a promise of "Lush and Beautiful Gas-Lit French Quarter Courtyard with Exquisite Fountains." There was one fountain, and no evidence of gas lights anywhere. Parking was also an issue. I was told there was limited self parking at their sister hotel, the St. Pierre at 911 Burgundy Street. When I asked where to park, I was told that the St. Pierre's lot was full and I would have to go elsewhere. Room Problems: Fire sprinkler on western wall was painted over. Electrical outlet on western wall do not work. Mirror on northern wall was not firmly attached to wall and wobbled at slightest disturbance. The top socket in the electrical outlet could not keep anything plugged in due to its looseness. One of the beds' sheets had unidentifiable dark spots. One bed was missing a middle knob. Desk was missing knobs. Old nails were left sticking out of the walls and just painted over. The neck and switch for the lamp on the nightstand were not in tightly and turned when you tried to switch the lamp on. The closet door stuck when trying to open or close it. The closet had an odd odor. The bathroom door stuck when trying to open or close it, and it could not be opened all of the way due to the bed placement. Cabinets under the sink in the bathroom had warped doors that did not meet all the way down the middle. No thermostat in room, but the thermostat in 107 seemed to control the temperature for both rooms. The ceiling fan shook as it ran. When pulling the cords for the lights and the fan, it tilted from side to side and shook. Middle light in ceiling fan light fixture was burned out. There were various cosmetic problems with the paint - peeling, discoloration, and water damage.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, freindly and lots of charm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful week at the Andrew Jackson Hotel. The room was clean, neat and fresh. The breakfast was simple but just enough to get us going. We loved sitting in the courtyard by the fountain. The location is in the middle of all the French Quarter activities. We will be back! Two thumbs up...Joan

Reviews.Title: “A homeless shelter is better, I bet !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many European hotels with"Old World Charm", I thought I knew what I was booking at the Andrew Jackson Hotel. How wrong I was! I never expected the dirty, filthy, disgustingly rank room that was given to us. I booked 3 months in advance for a room with a double bed, and upon arrival, we were given a room with 2 twin beds, with room for nothing else. I went to the front desk to complain, and she told me nothing else was available. I demanded to know who gave our reserved room away and like magic she found us another room. Finally, I thought we were getting somewhere, until we opened that room and the smell was so bad I got dry heeves.NO KIDDING.The room looked so filthy I did not want to even sit on the bed. Now it is time to park. When I made reservations I was told that they had parking. When we asked where to park, we were told lot was full and we were directed to go to a public parking area about 6 blocks away.Ok so we did. She neglected to tell us that the parking was $4 an hour , and we had a 2 day booking so you do the math on about a 48 hour stay. That was the last straw, we drove back and told the clerk everything was horrible and we were leaving. We were charged for 1 night stay at a rate that was probably the highest they charge. When I pointed out on her desk was a flyer advertising roooms at a considerable lower rate, she said "Those rooms are not available". What a joke.I have never complained like this about any hotels that I have stayed in..I just hope I can save 1 person the grief that we went through .Thank You.

Reviews.Title: “Our spot in the French Quarter for location and value....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to New Orleans for the first time this month. We wanted a reasonably priced, small hotel in the French Quarter. After looking around we found the Andrew Jackson Hotel. We were pleased with what we found. Rooms were nice, courtyard lovely, rates reasonable and the staff was very helpful. The location is great so we could easily walk to interesting shops and wonderful dining. Ask for a courtyard or Royal Street room. Breakfast is simple but fresh. Kim

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Andrew Jackson Hotel, Loved the Location on Royal Street”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed at the Andrew Jackson Hotel in January '05 for three nights. We received warm greetings and enjoyed a nice, clean room. The hotel is in a superb location in the French Quarter and at very reasonable rates. Our room faced Royal Street, so we sat on the wonderful balcony for breakfast each morning. Housekeeping was fine but a little slow, no real problems. We love New Orleans and we hope to come back for a much longer stay at the Andrew Jackson Hotel. Rene K.

Reviews.Title: “great little place”
Reviews.Author: jen_co
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had a girl's weekend here. We really enjoyed our stay. Now, this is not a 5 star hotel...so don't expect it! It is more in line with European boutique hotels. We were in room # 202. It had a king bed, good size bathroom, but the best was the balcony overlooking Royal St. We sat outside a few times everyday!!! The location is hard to beat. It was amazing that it was as quiet as it was in the evening with Bourbon St. just a block over. We were able to check in early, which was nice. The carpets in the room were a little threadbare, the bedspread was old, and the bathtub was snug...but hey, great price, great location, great views! I would definitely book this place again. Alas, be aware that if you go on a haunted house tour that you will stop at this hotel. Legend has it that a few young boys haunt the place, mainly room #208. Thankfully, room 202 is at the other end of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, intimate hotel with a great location...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great week at this friendly, comfortable hotel located in a restored French Quarter townhouse. The location (on Royal Street, French Quarter) is great and the staff is very nice. Our room was clean and neat with a nice new marble bathroom. Don't expect a cookie cutter chain type hotel, each room looks unique and different. Our vote: We are coming back next year, we already booked our same room for Mardi Gras! Sandra P. Houston, TX

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is good value”
Reviews.Author: Captain_Caveman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is placed in an excellent position to visit New Orleans. Do not expect a Marriot Hotel. This is a quirky hotel and the furniture is lets say shabby chic. It is reasonably priced and if you go wanting to get a taste of new orleans then you will get it. I stayed in a room out the back which to be fair was small but it had everything you needed. This hotel is round the corner from Bourbon Street ... staggering distance if it suits.

Reviews.Title: “Checked Out Early!!!”
Reviews.Author: snroberts11
Reviews.Content: I won't write a long review. All I can say about this hotel is that the lobby is nice and the rooms are small, drafty, filthy, dank, and furnished with crap that I would not pick-up off the corner if they were throwing it away. Don't waste your time or money. P.S. By the way; I travel a lot and at the rate that we got our room, I didn't expect much, but I have literally stayed in $29 a night motels in the middle of nowhere that were nicer than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Great, staff and rooms are pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a fantastic long weekend at the Andrew Jackson Hotel. The staff was very knowlegble and our room was clean and neat. Best of all was the location...in the center of the French Quarter. We give our stay two thumbs up. Terry and Frank Seattle, WA

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Waste your time with this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tracylynn2821
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in January of 2004 for the long MLK holiday weekend. It was by far our worst experience ever staying in a hotel. The room was beyond disgusting, the carpeting was filthy, my white socks were black within minutes, the bathroom was so small you could barely move in it. We were guaranteed a king size bed but upon our arrival we were told there wasn't a room available with a king size bed only a queen but they still tried to charge us for the king size room. The website bragged about what a wonderful courtyard the hotel had, it was just as filthy as our room was. And there was a homeless person sleeping in the hotel lobby every night. While the location of this hotel is great it's not worth wasting your money on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby....yes Bad.....no”
Reviews.Author: FrugalTraveler50
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the hotel 3 times this year and will be returning soon. Have been in a room with a queen sized bed and sofa, one with twin beds and one with 2 double beds. Some were newly painted, some needed a little work but none were dirtyThe rooms are not large and the furniture is miss matched. but staying in an older small hotel in the French Quarter I did not expect or want a cookie cutter modern room. Not every room has it's own air conditon control but all had a ceiling fan. Most of the bedrooms have been refurbished. Hopefully they will get around to the bathrooms but with shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, mouthwash and tissues provided, I didn't really have a problem with the decor. Yes if you walk around in the room without shoes your socks or feet will get black so bring a pair of slippers. The staff is fantastic always giving a hello and a smile. The doughnuts, bagels and cereal provided in the morning were fresh and tasty. The coffee hot and bitter the way it should be. The courtyard has limited seating but the guests were friendly and shared tables.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for memorial weekend. Really the only benefit of this hotel is the courtyard and location. The courtyard is charming and authentic; the location is perfect in the french quarter. The hotel itself leaves much to be desired. Dirty and old. That's the only way I can describe it. We had a standard room that had just enough room for a bed.....but barely. Bathroom was falling apart. This place should be a museum....not somewhere to sleep. Didn't have a very pleasant odor either. The staff, however, was nice. There's better places to stay if you're traveling to new orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The one review that says the breakfast was hard donuts, lousy coffee, filthy rooms hit it right on the head here. This was my 20th anniversary and I was assured that this would be a great room overlooking the street. Room greeted us with beer can and cigarette butts on the balcony. Room was so filthy that I requested new sheets. Take off your shoes and the socks turned black INSTANTLY. The next morning painting and wallpapering took place.. called three times in advance never told about this. Did move to sister hotel which was slightly better, BUT only slightly. Shower terrible, bathroom door didn't close..the only relief we got from the room was when we left. Thank goodness New Orleans was great -this place is the worst!

HotelInfo.Name: Andrew Jackson Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 919 Royal Street, New Orleans, LA 70116
